Title: Visualizing Another Node With `ex_top`
Teaser: A quick demonstration of the `ex_top` tool for visualizing a remote Erlang node, as well as a bit of code spelunking and a look at the use of the `rpc` module to do cool stuff.

Title: Parsing and Searching HTML With Floki
Teaser: A really nice library for parsing HTML and finding elements in it using CSS selectors.

Title: Streaming Structured Data From Webpages With Stream.resource
Teaser: Combining Floki and Stream.resource to turn a static HTML site into a paginating stream of structured data.

Title: Stripe
Teaser: Using Rob Conery's `stripity_stripe` library to easily work with Stripe's API.

Title: Visualixir
Teaser: A tool to visualize your application and trace messages between processes in the browser.

Title: Tracking Performance Metrics with Beaker
Teaser: A lightweight tool that gives you an instant performance monitoring dashboard for Gauges, Counters, and TimeSeries.

Title: Code Linting with Credo
Teaser: A code linting tool focused on giving gentle suggestions and providing explanations for the issues it uncovers.

Title: Internationalizing a Phoenix Application with Gettext
Teaser: An overview of Phoenix's new Gettext support for allowing easy string translation in your app for various locales.

Title: CSV
Teaser: A look at an unbelievably well-built CSV encoding and decoding library that deals exclusively in Streams.

Title: User Authentication with Ueberauth
Teaser: A library for flexible user authentication, whether from an OAuth provider, a local database, or something else.

Title: Bureaucrat API Documentation
Teaser: A tool to generate end-user API Documentation from your existing API Controller tests.

Title: `erl_festival`
Teaser: Using the festival speech synthesis tool from Elixir.

Title: TDDing an E-Commerce Site With Phoenix, Part 1 - Setup
Teaser: Kicking off a new project to test-drive a Phoenix app, using Hound for an acceptance test layer.

Title: TDDing an E-Commerce Site With Phoenix, Part 2 - Images
Teaser: Using Arc to store product images on S3, make thumbnails, and render them in the templates.

Title: TDDing an E-Commerce Site With Phoenix, Part 3 - Cart
Teaser: Test-Driving a basic cart implementation, which requires adding a LineItem model.  Bonus: Josh fixes bugs on the fly and gets really irritated!

Title: TDDing an E-Commerce Site with Phoenix, Part 4 - Multiple Carts
Teaser: Introducing an actual Cart model.  Involves multiple browser sessions with Hound, autogenerating UUID fields in Ecto models, and Elixir's multi-alias feature that was introduced in 1.2.

Title: TDDing an E-Commerce Site With Phoenix, Part 5 - Updating Carts
Teaser: Adding support for removing and updating LineItem quantities.  As a bonus, introducing vim-test, which makes ExUnit testing in vim far more pleasant.

Title: TDDing an E-Commerce Site With Phoenix, Part 6 - Completing an Order
Teaser: Introducing an Order model, and a Register module that encapsulates the logic around turning a Cart into an Order.  Also, a brief introduction to Ecto transactions.

Title: TDDing an E-Commerce Site With Phoenix, Part 7 - Stripe
Teaser: Adding the ability for the Register to charge a credit card for the Order via the Stripe API.

Title: TDDing an E-Commerce Site With Phoenix, Part 8 - Stripe Checkout
Teaser: Using Stripe's `Checkout` library to provide a nice user experience and avoid handling sensitive credit card details server-side.

Title: The `i` Helper
Teaser: A new feature in Elixir 1.2 to provide information about any piece of data.

Title: Pi Walk With Logo
Teaser: A random walk through Pi using our Logo interpreter.

Title: Encryption and Hashing
Teaser: An explanation of one way hashes, HMACs, password hashing, and a discussion about encryption proper.

Title: Hedwig Bot Framework
Teaser: Building chatbots with Elixir.  With XMPP, Slack, and HipChat adapters already available.

Title: Hedwig Twitter Bot
Teaser: Modifying our existing Hedwig bot to interact with Twitter via ExTwitter.

Title: Supervising Hedwig Twitter
Teaser: Using `Task.Supervisor` to supervise our chatbot's ExTwitter streams, restarting them in the event of failure.

Title: OpenGL in Elixir
Teaser: Beginning an exploration of OpenGL programming in Elixir, using wx.  We'll be porting the NeHe OpenGL tutorials.

Title: OpenGL Part 2 - Color and Depth
Teaser: Introducing color to our scenes, and making use of the Z coordinates so that we aren't just drawing fancy 2D scenes.

Title: OpenGL: 3D Bitmaps
Teaser: Introducing trivially repeatable shapes with GL Display Lists, and rendering a bitmap as cubes in a scene.

Title: OpenGL Extris
Teaser: Hooking our OpenGL Bitmap renderer into the Extris game, to render our Tetris clone in 3D.

Title: Phoenix and Elm
Teaser: Using `elm-brunch` to wire your Elm application into Phoenix's default build pipeline.

Title: Constraint Solving
Teaser: Using for comprehensions to solve some basic constraint modeling problems.

Title: Bamboo Email
Teaser: A library from Thoughtbot that makes it easy to send emails that is testable, composable, and adapter-based.

Title: Moebius - Functional Database Queries
Teaser: A library from Rob Conery for querying PostgreSQL databases that is composable, supports JSONB document databases, and in general makes constructing queries extremely pleasant.

Title: Raycaster
Teaser: Casting rays and simulating how light falls when cut off by various walls. (This is just the setup though!)

Title: Raycaster Part 2: Finding Intersections
Teaser: Calculating where 2 lines intersect, and using that to determine where walls occlude rays of light

Title: Raycaster Part 3: Finishing Up
Teaser: Wrapping up our raycaster project, resulting in a really fun simulation of light occlusion.

Title: Phoenix.Presence Chat
Teaser: Implementing chat and a user list on top of Phoenix.Presence, a new feature coming in Phoenix 1.2

Title: Hunt Gather
Teaser: An Elixir pattern for trivially parallelizing work that has no ordering constraints.

Title: Webpack, Phoenix, and Elm
Teaser: A walkthrough of starting a new webpack-based project in Phoenix, getting most of the existing out-of-the-box Brunch feature support, and introducing Elm compilation and scss as well.

Title: Constraint Solving, Part 2: N-Queens Problem
Teaser: Solving the "N-Queens Problem" driven by tests and types.

Title: Constraint Solving, Part 3: N-Queens Problem, Part 2
Teaser: Finishing up our solution to the N-Queens Problem, driven by tests and types.

Title: Elixir 1.3 Mix Tasks
Teaser: Checking out the new mix tasks provided in Elixir 1.3: `xref`, `app.tree`, `deps.tree`, `test --stale`, and `escript.install`

Title: `gen_state_machine`
Teaser: Exploring Erlang 19's new `gen_statem` behaviour by way of an idiomatic Elixir wrapper, by modeling a door lock with it.

Title: Ecto 2.0
Teaser: Ecto 2.0 was released.  We'll look at it from the ground up, pointing out a few things that have changed with this release.

Title: Ecto 2.0 Exploration
Teaser: Digging into the corners a bit in the latest features in Ecto 2.0

Title: OTP Pipeline
Teaser: Building an umbrella application with 2 OTP apps in it, to produce a decoupled RSS handling pipeline.

Title: with
Teaser: Exploring Elixir's `with` Special Form, to ease error handling.

Title: Commanding the Client with Phoenix Channels
Teaser: Adding a control channel for your frontend clients to facilitate sending RPC-style commands into them from the backend.

Title: Phoenix Chat Persistence
Teaser: Persisting message in chat and providing the chat history to clients when they connect.

Title: NIFs
Teaser: Building a Native Implemented Function and corresponding Elixir module, writing the Makefile, and integrating it into mix.

Title: GenStage By Way of Pairing
Teaser: In which Theron Boerner and I paired on prototyping a Continuous Integration server workflow using GenStage to produce jobs for specific machines and consume them appropriately.

Title: Phoenix Is An Interface, Not Your Application
Teaser: All of this has happened before. All of this will happen again.

Title: Phoenix Is An Interface, Not Your Application, Part 2
Teaser: Completing our Channels-based collaboration, seeing another "I didn't think this through" mistake, and seeing some benefits that OTP app separation help us accrue.

Title: ShortMaps
Teaser: A small library that provides a sigil to get the equivalent of ES6 Object Destructuring and Shorthand Property Names in Elixir.

Title: Currying (and More) with Quark
Teaser: A library that adds some great features like Currying, Partial Function Application, and Composition to Elixir.

Title: Church Encoding in Elixir
Teaser: Or: The Coolest Thing I Know

Title: Guardian and Phoenix APIs
Teaser: Because you shouldn't let just **anyone** screw up your database. That's your users's job!

Title: Making Sure the Other Party is Wrong
Teaser: Because the only thing better than knowing you're right is knowing someone else is a failure.

Title: Slurping Links Out of a Free Slack with ExIrc
Teaser: GenServers and Supervision and IRC bots and queues.

Title: Phoenix Users with Coherence
Teaser: A relatively full-featured User Management System, with a broad feature set, that's pretty painless to set up.

Title: Boyd Multerer's `phoenix_integration`
Teaser: A supremely pleasant library for performing browserless integration tests against your Phoenix application.

Title: Phoenix API Pagination with Scrivener
Teaser: Using Scrivener.Headers to add pagination link information to the headers in our API responses, per an RFC Draft.

Title: Boyd Multerer's `policy_wonk`
Teaser: A library for painlessly enforcing authorization policies in your Phoenix applications.

Title: Direct Uploads with S3 in a Phoenix API
Teaser: Providing a restricted S3 policy to a user requesting to upload a file, and using jQuery File Upload to send it to S3.

Title: Slurping Links Out of a Free Slack with ExIrc, Part 2
Teaser: Pushing messages with links into the queue, building a quick WordPress API client with Tesla, and building a worker to pull items from the queue and push them into the API.

Title: Slurping Links Out of a Free Slack with ExIrc, Part 3 - GenStage to the Rescue
Teaser: Using GenStage to completely replace our queue-based system and provide us additional avenues for enhancement.

Title: Metaprogramming Model Validation Tests
Teaser: A quick tip for writing data-driven ExUnit tests.

Title: Using Distillery to Create a Release of our ExIrc Slack Bot
Teaser: Painlessly rolling a release tarball of our Elixir application, and producing a systemd unit to run it on system boot.

Title: Debugging Situations Where You Haven't Fully "Let It Crash"
Teaser: Identifying why our application stops working in certain crashing situations, and fixing it.

Title: Building a Dashboard with Kitto
Teaser: A dashboard framework descended from Dashing, with flair.

Title: GraphQL with Absinthe
Teaser: An introduction to GraphQL, using the Absinthe package to create a GraphQL server.

Title: neovim for Elixir
Teaser: Setting up neovim to have a nice Elixir editing environment

Title: Building a File Processing Server
Teaser: Starting a new OTP application to provide on-the-fly, configurable file transformations.

Title: Plugging In Fly
Teaser: Building a Plug to route requests to our job processing application.

Title: Adding an LRU Cache to Fly
Teaser: Using a Least-Recently-Used Cache to store our work and avoid repeating ourselves and avoid repeating ourselves.

Title: Mechanical Turkdown
Teaser: Building an entirely reasonable service for synchronous Markdown to HTML conversion, via Mechanical Turk

Title: Firestorm Pairing Session #1 - Josh Adams and Michal Muskala on HexView
Teaser: Work on an Elm API client for a project to view Elixir source packages.

Title: Firestorm Pairing Session 2 - Josh Adams and Claudio Ortolina Building a Subreddit Word Counter with Flow
Teaser: I pair with Claudio Ortolina to build my first Flow application.

Title: Firestorm Pairing Session 3 - Josh Adams and Claudio Ortolina Building a Subreddit Word Counter with Flow, Part 2
Teaser: Josh and Claudio Pair Further on RedditFlow

Title: Firestorm Pairing Session 4 - Josh Adams and Adam Dill Pairing on the Firestorm UI
Teaser: Pairing a bit to get the Firestorm UI started on good footing.

Title: Firestorm Pairing Session 5 - Josh Adams and Andrew Vy Working with Ecto Polymorphism
Teaser: Working through polymorphism in Ecto for Views and Follows (and eventually tags)
